intro: Requienia sphaerosperma, commonly known as the globe-fruit tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy, and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive spherical fruits that are yellow to orange in color. Its botanical features make it an important species in the unique flora of Madagascar, though it remains relatively understudied in scientific literature.
